item.title: TwoFace
item.description: This Sublime Text package makes it possible to toggle between two different UI-appearances with the same hotkey. It is also possible to set a absolute UI. It changes both the color scheme and the UI-theme. It changes all elements of the UI defined in the settings file. item.title: TwoFont
item.description: This Sublime Text package makes it possible to toggle between two different fonts with the same hotkey. It is also possible to set a absolute font. It changes all elements of the fonts defined in the settings file. TwoFont.sublime-settings The keys font1 and font2 is mandatory. { "font1": { "font_face": "Hack", "font_size": 18, "font_options": ["no_bold", "no_italic", "subpixel_antialias"] }, "font2": { "font_face": "Fixedsys Excelsior 3.01-L2 Mono", "font_size": 12, "font_options": ["no_bold", "no_italic", "no_antialias"] }, "monaco": { "font_face": "Monaco", "font_size": 14, "font_options": ["no_bold", "no_italic", "subpixel_antialias"] }, "Inconsolata": { "font_face": "Inconsolata", "font_size": 20, "font_options": ["no_bold", "no_italic", "subpixel_antialias"] } } user.

item.title: i3syntax
item.description: This Sublime Text package adds a simple syntax highlighting to the i3 config. It only adds highlighting to comments. Installing the package also adds the ability to toggle comments. You can also define “symbols” (default hotkey in sublime: ctrl+r) by making a comment in this fashion: # > this is a section. I host this package on github.
